description: From New Latin syntacticus, from Ancient Greek συντακτικός (suntaktikós).

adjectives.description: syntactic (comparative more syntactic, superlative most syntactic)

entries.meaning: Of, related to or connected with syntax.
examples: The sentence “I saw he” contains a syntactic mistake.

entries.meaning: Containing morphemes that are combined in the same order as they would be if they were separate words e.g. greenfinch
